org.svvrl.goal.core.draw

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.draw.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircleNode, SquareNode

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A Node is a visual component for states.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      • createMainShape

        protected abstract java.awt.Shape createMainShape(java.awt.geom.Point2D center)
        Creates the main shape to be displayed for this node at a specified position.
        Parameters:
        center - the central point of the shape to be created
        Returns:
        the shape to be displayed for this node

      • createAcceptingShape

        protected abstract java.awt.Shape createAcceptingShape(java.awt.geom.Point2D center)
        Creates the shape at a specified position to indicate that this node is an accepting state. In this case, the constructed shape is displayed above the shaped constructed by #createMainShape(Point2D).
        Parameters:
        center - the central point of the shape to be created
        Returns:
        the shape indicating that this node is an accepting state

      • getCrossPoint

        public abstract java.awt.geom.Point2D getCrossPoint(double theta)
        Returns the cross point between the outline of this node and the line from the central point of this node with an angle theta (from the x-axis). The angle theta should be within the range from - 3.141592653589793 to 3.141592653589793.
        Parameters:
        theta - an angle between -3.141592653589793 and 3.141592653589793
        Returns:
        the cross point

      • getCrossPoint

        public abstract Pair<java.awt.geom.Point2D,java.awt.geom.Point2D> getCrossPoint(Orientation orient)
        Returns a pair of points that correspond to the start point and the end point of the self-loop of this node.
        Parameters:
        orient - the orientation of the self-loop
        Returns:
        a pair of points that correspond to the start point and the end point of the self-loop of this node
